thread.title: Fort Collins mom wins $10K for cancer research on 'Ellen'
thread.title_full: Fort Collins mom wins $10K for cancer research on 'Ellen'

title: Fort Collins mom wins $10K for cancer research on 'Ellen'
text:
Fort Collins mom wins $10K for cancer research on 'Ellen' Erin Udell , erinudell@coloradoan.com 10:03 p.m. MDT October 7, 2015 Comedian and talk show host Ellen DeGeneres pulled a Fort Collins mom from the audience for a special segment during a taping of her show last month. (Photo: Chris Haston/NBC Universal) 10 CONNECT 12 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Fort Collins mom Gina Hand got to whip her hair back and forth during a segment of The Ellen DeGeneres Show last month, netting $10,000 for the Breast Cancer Research Foundation. 
In a clip posted to the show’s website on Sept. 30, Hand is shown being picked from the crowd to play a game called, “I Whip My Head Back & Forth!” where she whipped around a ball attached to her head via stockings trying to hit various targets. 
While Hand knocked down only three of 10 targets, DeGeneres said the show would still donate the full $10,000. And, for being such a good sport, Hand also nabbed herself a $500 Visa gift card. 
Watch the clip of Hand’s Ellen experience here:
